intro: Pouzolzia wightii var. caudata, commonly known as the long-stalked pouzolzia, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
